comments.body: This has the side effect of setting `google-cloud-core>=1.4.1`, which sounds like is the true workaround for #36436

Looking at a recent CI failure https://travis-ci.org/github/pandas-dev/pandas/jobs/728321735
```
google-cloud-bigquery     1.25.0             pyh32f6830_0    conda-forge

google-cloud-bigquery-core 1.25.0           py37hc8dfbb8_0    conda-forge

google-cloud-bigquery-storage 0.8.0                      py_0    conda-forge

google-cloud-bigquery-storage-core 0.8.0                    py37_0    conda-forge

google-cloud-core         1.4.1                      py_0  
```

The google-cloud-core version was already 1.4.1. But the bug was still present. I wonder where did they actually fix it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@  - openpyxl
  - pandas-gbq
  - google-cloud-bigquery>=1.27.2 # GH 36436
  - psycopg2
  - pyarrow>=0.15.0

comments.body: It's not related to gbq. Just trying to find out if the sql failures are due to new package versions.
I could revert this and open a new issue about sql. But the cov build would fail.
